company.name: Rising Pharma
company.purpose: To align leadership on a digital-first transformation roadmap focused on R&D acceleration, regulatory agility, and cost optimization across the manufacturing network.
key_info: Founded in 1996 and headquartered in New Jersey, USA.
Specializes in complex generic and specialty formulations.
Recent investment in biologics and biosimilar development.
Planning expansion of API manufacturing in India and the US.
Facing rising regulatory compliance requirements in both FDA and EMA regions.
Partnered with Microsoft for digital quality management system (QMS).
objectives: Define top three digital transformation priorities for the next 18 months.
Identify key operational bottlenecks in R&D and manufacturing processes.
Establish shared metrics for innovation efficiency and compliance readiness.
Design a leadership communication model for faster decision-making.
Align teams on cultural change and data-driven accountability.

intel.latest: Rising Pharma announced a strategic alliance with BioNxt for biosimilar development in August 2025 and a $20 M automation upgrade of its Hyderabad facility.
intel.financial: FY2024 revenue grew 11% YoY to $740 M; R&D spend at 12% of revenue. Cash flow positive with $85 M liquidity. Margins improving from lean manufacturing initiatives.
intel.competitors: Primary competitors: Teva Pharmaceuticals (global generics scale), Lupin Ltd. (R&D efficiency), and Zydus Lifesciences (US-focused pipeline acceleration). Rising differentiates through quality compliance and niche formulations.
extras: Recently implemented SAP S/4 HANA for global finance integration.
Under evaluation for FDA 2025 audit readiness program.
CEO publicly committed to carbon-neutral manufacturing by 2030.
